page.title: 08CHILBOLTON VILLAGE
page.content: CHILBOLTON IS SURROUNDED BY FARMLAND AND SEPARATED FROM WHERWELL AND A FARMING HAMLET,FULLERTON,BY THE RIVER TEST.THE RIVER,IN 3 DISTRIBUTARIES,LIES IN A FLAT VALLEY BETWEEN HIGH HILLS UP TO 90M A.S.L. COW COMMON(A PROPOSED S.S.S.I.)IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC AS IS WEST DOWN,ABOVE CHILBOLTON. THE CENTRE OF THE VILLAGE IS A CONSERVATION AREA,WITH PERIOD COTTAGES (MAINLY ENLARGED) OCCUPIED BY OLDER ,WEALTHIER PEOPLE,INTERSPERSED WITH NEWER,LARGE HOUSES. A COUNCIL ESTATE(1950'S) AND A PRIVATE ESTATE(1960'S)ARE ON THE HILL ABOVE THE OLD VILLAGE. A NEW ESTATE IS BEING BUILT OF EXPENSIVE HOUSES;IN FUTURE NEW HOUSES WILL BE INFILL ONLY BECAUSE OF LOCAL PLANNING RULES. THERE ARE 350 HOUSES AND 900 PEOPLE IN THE VILLAGE.
